text: "...actually a pretty good anti-crime bill."
author: loisbeckett

text: More on lawmakers' quick response to this important investigation from @jilltucker and @JoaquinPalomino:
author: loisbeckett

text: But huge spending on nearly empty juvenile halls is a problem across California, the investigation revealed--including in Silicon Valley, and in "liberal" Oakland and Berkeley:
author: loisbeckett

text:
Impact: one day after @sfchronicle's investigation, San Francisco lawmakers announced legislation to close the city's juvenile hall. 

Spending $13 million dollars a year to keep a tiny number of kids incarcerated is "a stunning misuse of city funds."
author: loisbeckett

text: As Fox News faces heightened scrutiny over its ties to the White House + Jeanine Pirro's Islamophobic comment + Tucker Carlson's white nationalist/ racist rhetoric, Fox host Laura Ingraham is personally attacking a 29-year-old freelancer

text:
.@chick_in_kiev managed to investigate and break news....about targeted harassment of laid-off journalists...in the middle of layoffs at the company where she was working. 

That's the kind of work, in tough circumstances, that actual journalists respect.

text:
One of you is referencing gun murders. One is referencing all gun deaths, including gun suicides, which have risen sharply: https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2018/dec/13/us-gun-deaths-levels-cdc-2017 …

author: loisbeckett

text:
6 days after a mass shooting: New Zealand announced a ban on military-style weapons

10 days after a mass shooting: Australia announced a new national firearms strategy

7 months after a mass shooting: UK announced a handgun ban
author: loisbeckett

text:
John Forester, who used to run the Reading Eagle intern program, was a brilliant, generous, tough love mentor. He helped me identify the things I was doing wrong. (Some of them I'm still working through.) 

Where are the next generation of teachers? Where do they work?
author: loisbeckett

text: This isn't just a threat to readers in Pennsylvania. @ReadingEagle trained journalists--including me--who now work nationwide. The entire system for developing American reporters is being gutted as local papers struggle or shrink:
author: loisbeckett

text: This is terrible news. A newsroom full of tough, funny reporters and editors—and a paper that took training young journalists seriously.
author: loisbeckett

text:
Last year, taxpayers in Silicon Valley were paying $514,000 per kid per year to keep children incarcerated. 

In Oakland and Berkeley, taxpayers were paying $493,000 per kid per year.

What they were paying for: https://projects.sfchronicle.com/2019/visuals/vanishing-violence-visual-essay/ …
author: loisbeckett

text:
It would be cheaper to send struggling California kids to private schools and give their families support than it is to lock them up in in small cement cells, a traumatizing practice that makes no one safer. 

California still chooses to lock them up: 

https://projects.sfchronicle.com/2019/vanishing-violence/part-2/ …
author: loisbeckett

text:
Nevada County spent, on average, $1,461 a day on each child incarcerated in juvenile hall. 

$1,461 a day. 

Powerful @sfchronicle series on how California is *still* paying for the expensive, almost empty prisons meant to hold "juvenile super-predators."
author: loisbeckett
loisbeckett

text:
Racist tropes. Painful personal details. 

⁦@SamTLevin⁩ on the prosecutor’s playbook for dealing with citizens killed by police. 

“The murderer becomes the victim, and the victim becomes the criminal.” 

https://amp.theguardian.com/us-news/2019/mar/20/us-police-killings-district-attorney-prosecutor-reports#click=https://t.co/aK2s6IopB8 … https://amp.theguardian.com/us-news/2019/mar/20/us-police-killings-district-attorney-prosecutor-reports#click=https://t.co/aK2s6IopB8 …

text: New Zealand's action today is "the fastest response ever by a government after a tragedy," said Rebecca Peters, who helped lead the campaign to reform Australia's gun laws in the 1990s:
author: loisbeckett

text:
One of the long-term consequences of Brett Kavanaugh's confirmation: 

He has argued that assault weapon bans are unconstitutional, and that there's no "meaningful or persuasive" difference between semi-automatic handguns and rifles: https://www.theguardian.com/law/2018/jul/10/supreme-court-brett-kavanaugh-assault-weapons-ban-unconstitutional …
author: loisbeckett

text: Also worth remembering: Kavanaugh's confirmation may have blocked more aggressive gun control laws not just for the next two years, but for a generation.
author: loisbeckett

text: Yup.
author: loisbeckett

text:
Gun rights advocates--inside and outside the NRA--are a relatively small group of people. But they are organized. They show up, and they show up reliably. They understand all the levers of democracy, and they are strategizing decades in advance.

That's why they've been winning.
author: loisbeckett

text:
We spend a lot of time in this debate musing on America's gun culture. 

Gun owners are a minority in this country. NRA members represent maybe 10% of all gun owners. 

You don't need the support of 90% of the public. You don't need big cultural change. You just need the votes.
author: loisbeckett

text:
Worth remembering: 

The current barrier to the US passing (moderate) gun control laws is not some massive change in public opinion. It's 11 Republican votes in the Senate. 

Without the filibuster, it would be 2 votes.
author: loisbeckett

text: New Zealand has no clue how many military-style semi-automatic weapons there are in the country. That's why they are budgeting anywhere from $100 million to $200 million to buy them back: https://www.theguardian.com/world/live/2019/mar/21/new-zealand-shooting-jacinda-ardern-to-make-policy-announcement-live-updates?page=with:block-5c92f7c8e4b0480f6c022e0b#block-5c92f7c8e4b0480f6c022e0b …
author: loisbeckett

text: What implementing an Australia-style mandatory gun buyback might--and might not--accomplish in the United States:
author: loisbeckett

text: (Corrected from an earlier tweet to six days)
author: loisbeckett

text:
6 days after the Christchurch mass shooting, New Zealand announces it will follow Australia's example: a ban of military-style weapons, a mandatory buyback, $100-$200 million to compensate gun owners. 

“This is just the beginning of the work."
author: loisbeckett

text: American gun rights advocates have said this kind of Australia-inspired gun ban and confiscation would prompt “a civil war”.
author: loisbeckett

text: If the United States wanted to do an Australia-style gun ban, it would require a buyback of an estimated 90 million firearms, at a cost that might be in the billions of dollars: https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2016/jun/21/gun-control-debate-mass-shootings-gun-violence …
author: loisbeckett

text: The police minister adds that police have power to go into license dealers and ask for records, and they will be doing this to check who still has these weapons. https://www.theguardian.com/world/live/2019/mar/21/new-zealand-shooting-jacinda-ardern-to-make-policy-announcement-live-updates …
author: loisbeckett

text:
New Zealand's minister of police said that police are “gearing up” to enable military-style weapons to be taken out of circulation. Police will be supported by the New Zealand defense force, he said. 

https://www.theguardian.com/world/live/2019/mar/21/new-zealand-shooting-jacinda-ardern-to-make-policy-announcement-live-updates …
author: loisbeckett

text:
5 days after the Christchurch mass shooting, New Zealand announces it will follow Australia's example: a ban of military-style weapons, a mandatory buyback, $100-$200 million to compensate gun owners. 

“This is just the beginning of the work."

text: New Zealand's ban on military-style rifles goes into effect today, the Prime Minister announced. There will be a buyback plan that will provide "“Fair and reasonable compensation” to those who bought now-banned weapons: https://www.theguardian.com/world/live/2019/mar/21/new-zealand-shooting-jacinda-ardern-to-make-policy-announcement-live-updates?page=with:block-5c92f229e4b0480f6c022dec#block-5c92f229e4b0480f6c022dec …

text:
Experts have spent years warning journalists of the dangers of "amplifying" extremist ideas.

Because articles mocking white supremacist conspiracies at the top of the NYT homepage...

Are still articles giving coverage to white supremacist ideas. 

At the top of the NYT homepage

text: “He was down and bleeding and couldn’t move," Mack's father said."He was still alive … There was no reason to harm him anymore.”
author: loisbeckett

text:
The Los Angeles police commission just ruled that the officers who shot Grechario Mack when he was already on the ground "violated policy." 

“We were almost in disbelief,” a local activist said. The commission very rarely disagrees with officers' choices
author: loisbeckett

text:
Grechario Mack, a 30-year-old father, was having a mental health crisis in a mall in Los Angeles. 

Police shot him. 

Then, when he was already on the ground, they shot him again. 

His family says the final shots were the ones that killed him. https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2019/mar/20/los-angeles-police-commission-grechario-mack …
author: loisbeckett

text: Still thinking about this @juliacarriew interview from earlier today. It's a great example of how a tougher interview questions, from a more skeptical interviewer, actually gives an interview subject more of an opportunity to make interesting points:
author: loisbeckett

text: A tougher line of questioning about whether his Theranos documentary is too sympathetic to Holmes prompts some really interesting--and thoughtful-- responses from director Alex Gibney: https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2019/mar/17/americans-have-a-fascination-with-fraudsters-alex-gibney-on-the-fall-of-theranos-and-elizabeth-holmes …
author: loisbeckett

text: .@juliacarriew pulls no punches in this interview with Alex Gibney on his new Theranos documentary. She asks about how Elizabeth Holmes was buoyed and protected by the support of older men--and if the film falls into the same trap: https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2019/mar/17/americans-have-a-fascination-with-fraudsters-alex-gibney-on-the-fall-of-theranos-and-elizabeth-holmes …

text: A reminder of something a gun violence expert told me a while back: fear and uncertainty and changed behavior in everyday life are part of the toll of gun violence in this country. It's a lesser a cost than direct injury or grief, but one that many more people pay.

text:

June 2017: Van plows into the crowd outside a North London mosque, killing one 

August 2017: A car plows into a crowd of protesters in Charlottesville, killing one and injuring dozens

https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/mar/16/a-history-of-recent-attacks-linked-to-white-supremacism …

text:
"We are experiencing an invasion on a level never seen before in history." 

“People hate the word invasion, but that’s what it is.”

Two quotes about immigrants in the past 24 hours. One from the US president, one from a document justifying a white supremacist terror attack.
author: loisbeckett

text:
White supremacist terror attacks are deeply connected to mainstream politics. 

Jo Cox was murdered in the weeks before the Brexit vote. 

The Pittsburgh synagogue shooting came a week before the US midterms, as the president and Fox News fearmongered about the "migrant caravan."
author: loisbeckett

text: "Google searches for "black on white crime" conducted by NPR in December 2016 and January 2017 found the top results included multiple white supremacist websites." https://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/01/10/508363607/what-happened-when-dylann-roof-asked-google-for-information-about-race …
author: loisbeckett

text: When we talk about the white supremacist radicalization, we have to talk about the most basic pathways: Recommendations. Autofill. Search results.
author: loisbeckett

text: An essential journalist to follow is @jason_a_w, an Australian reporter who now lives in Portland. Jason has reported extensively on white supremacist violence and propaganda in both Australia and the US. He connects the dots of the global network of white supremacist activism.
author: loisbeckett

text:
Mosques. Synagogues. Black churches. Left-wing politicians. 

Some of the targets of white supremacist terror in the past eight years:
author: loisbeckett

text:
In Australia, Sky News took apparent footage of the mosque shooting, by the shooter, and they put it on TV. 

Sky News broadcast it repeatedly. 

They defended the choice by saying they did not air the parts where people were killed in close view.
author: loisbeckett

text:
The leading journalistic expert on the Columbine shootings wrote, of the media: 

"We did not start this, nor have we pulled any triggers. But the killers have made us reliable partners." 

Reliable. Partners.
